summary: "Such is Life" Arad lom, ir i 'welu ro-long ar i nae ú-belir beriad, Edhel linna 'lîr lom Edhellen o chuil. Na *neviad. A drowsy summer afternoon, when the air is so heavy that even the shade offers no protection, an Elf sings a drowsy Sindarin song about life. Translation included. *Nevia- Neo-Sindarin word for "to translate", based on Sindarin "nef".
